paper_abstract: For odd integer m >= 3 and t = 0,1, ......, m-1/2, we define Family V/ (t) to be a set of size 2 (m(t+1)) containing binary sequences of period 2 (m+1) - 2. The nontrivial correlations between sequences in Family are bounded in magnitude by 2 + 2((m+1)/2+t) . Families V(0) and V (1) compare favourably to the small and large Kasami sets, respectively. So far, the correlation distribution of Family V (t) is only known for t = 0. A general framework for computing the correlation distribution of Family V (t) is established. The correlation distribution of V(1) is derived, and a way to obtain the correlation distribution of V (2) is described.
paper_title: On the correlation distribution of Delsarte-Goethals sequences
